original: Jansson, Carl Erik Martin, riks-idr:in’str., Götebor|g, f. 30/10/88 i Danmark, Upps. 1., av rätt. Carl-Fred-rik J. o. Augusta Wilhelmina Karlsson. G. 29 m. Gertrud Margareta Jansson. Barn: Carl-Anders Martin f. 30. — Genomg. Sv. idr:förb. ’kurser f. utbildn. av fören :instruktörer 11 o. 13, f. utbildn. av offic. dito 17. Anst. h. Sv. idr:förb. som idr :instruktör 17, som överinstruktör (vårt lands förste inhemske) 23-24. Styr:led. i IF Thor i Upps. 08-16, tillf. ordf. 13-14, kallad t. ständig led. 17. Var under sin aktiva idr:bana mycket god allr. idr :-man m. kast som bästa gren, erövr. bl. a. f. alltid Upps. GoSK vandr :pris i femk. 12, DM f. Uppl. i dito s. à., spjutkastn. 13, diskus 16, lagmäst. i stafett 4X100 m., kastade sederm. som instruktör diskus sammand. 84,60 m. (en m. bättre än då gäll. sv. rek.). Medarb. i tidn. o. tidskr. samt utarb. trän :program. Ett flertal idrottsl. förtj:- o. utm:tecken.
translated:
Jansson, Carl Erik Martin, national sports instructor, Gothenburg, born on 30/10/88 in Denmark, Uppsala University graduate, son of Carl-Fredrik J. and Augusta Wilhelmina Karlsson. Married on 29 to Gertrud Margareta Jansson. Children: Carl-Anders Martin, born on 30. 

Completed Swedish Sports Federation courses for training club instructors in 1911 and 1913, as well as courses for training officials in 1917. Employed by the Swedish Sports Federation as a sports instructor in 1917 and as a senior sports instructor (our country's first national) from 1923 to 1924. Served as board member of IF Thor in Uppsala from 1908 to 1916, temporary chairman in 1913-1914, and was appointed as a permanent member in 1917. 

During his active sports career, he excelled in throwing events, with javelin being his best discipline. He achieved several accomplishments, including winning the Uppsala GoSK Prize in the pentathlon in 1912, the Uppland County Championship in javelin throw in subsequent years, as well as winning the relay 4x100m as a team captain. He later set a distance of 84.60m in discus throw as an instructor, surpassing the then-existing Swedish record by one meter. He contributed to various newspapers and magazines and developed training programs. Received multiple sports honors and awards.

structured.name: Carl Erik Martin Jansson
awards: Uppland County Championship in javelin throw (various years)
Set a discus throw record of 84.60m
